The election of Macron, a 39-year-old business-savvy reformer, who swept away incumbent parties with a movement created barely a year ago, has triggered a wave of optimism in France and Europe that he can reinvigorate the French economy and the EU.
President Trump meets French President Emmanuel Macron in Paris this week to commemorate the 100th anniversary of America's entry into World War I.
At a time when, as Trump stated in Poland, the West doubts itself, this newfound vitality is a welcome development for the United States.
